yes exactly! I have phases just staring at the work and not drawing anything for maybe half an hour or something, or redoing a part for the nth time because I'm just not satisfied, which is why things look the way they look but it also takes so much longer than what I see at professional listings
like it's nice if the illustration is for myself ....until a client expects the same quality for their commission

usually im a "work smarter not harder" person and bullshitting myself through everything except.. for drawing. like the amount of time I sit on one illustration is so far from competitive that I could never do illustration as a job full-time and it lowkey kills me knowing that

yes french press works wonderfully too, I have one for when I have visitors and it'd be too much a hassle to make more than 1 cup otherwise
personally would recommend getting a size 2 ("2 cups") bc they work very well with mugs imo and in case you are using those small tea cup sized cups, you can just use half of everything
this is how they work/look like. the only thing you need outside of that is a water kettle, but I would assume you have one of those (?)

I as a coffee drinker use a porcellain filter holder that you put directly on the mug, it's no bigger than a mug itself so it doesn't take up much space

a whole ass coffee machine is kinda overkill, especially if you don't have any use for it yourself

subjective emotional perception. the distance helps me to take a step back and start analysing my art a bit more objectively, without the layer of feeling inadequate. then I can pick it apart constructively and see where I want to improve & how. (2/2)
